contentrichtext.text: In [[Greek mythology]], the name '''Emathion''' ({{lang-el|Ἠμαθίων}}) refers to four individuals. == Ethiopian king == Emathion was king of [[Aethiopia]], the son of [[Tithonus]] and [[Eos]], and brother of [[Memnon]]. [[Heracles]] killed him. == Samothracian == Emathion was king of [[Samothrace]], was the son of [[Zeus]] and [[Electra (Pleiad)|Electra]] (one of the [[Pleiades (Greek mythology)|Pleiades]]), brother to [[Dardanus]], [[Iasion]], [[Eetion]], and (rarely) [[Harmonia (Greek goddess)|Harmonia]]. He sent soldiers to join [[Dionysus]] in his Indian campaigns.<ref>[http://www.theoi.com/Nymphe/NympheElektra2.html Theoi Project – Elektra]</ref> == Trojan == Emathion was a [[Troy|Trojan]] prince, and the father of [[Atymnius]] and Diomedes, by the [[naiad]] Pegasis, daughter of the river god [[Granicus]].<ref>[http://www.theoi.com/Nymphe/NymphePegasis.html Theoi Project – Pegasis]</ref> == Aethiopian courtier == Emathion was an aged member of [[Cepheus, King of Aethiopia|Cepheus]]'s court. He "feared the gods and stood for upright deeds". He was killed by [[Chromis (mythology)|Chromis]] during the fight between [[Phineus (son of Belus)|Phineus]] and [[Perseus]].<ref>Ovid. ''Metamorphoses'', [http://www.theoi.com/Text/OvidMetamorphoses5.html 5.97]</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:Greek mythology]] [[Category:Mythological kings]] [[Category:Trojans]] [[Category:Offspring of Zeus]] {{Greek-myth-stub}}
